summary:
Over the years, varied posts in education were carried out. First as a teacher on several schools of primary education. Then as teacher and treatment/therapy coordinator of the deaf-blind at the Dutch ‘Institute for the Deaf’. 

In the meanwhile an academic graduation in the orthopedagogy (Msc) and several professional specialisms (e.g. ophthalmology, neuropsychology, prevention destructive behavior) were obtained. Those developments lead to the appointment as teacher educator (lecturer) and later as associate professor (associate lector) and professor (lector). 

Several additional posts are carried out such as auditor of (academic) professional development schools in the Netherlands. 
Member of the Committee of Advice for the Minister of education about the development and quality aspects of school-based learning. 
Member and chair of auditing committees under which teacher education colleges in the Netherlands and Flanders on behalf of the Accreditation Organization of the Netherlands and Flanders (NVAO). 

External project advisor of the Flemish ‘ZOISs-projectgroup’ (Self development instrument for workplace learning) and external reviewer project applications, Network of expertise, School of Education Association KULeuven (SoE). 
Project manager Center of Expertise Personal Mastership (CEPM). Reviewer and member review committee Taskforce for Applied Research (NRO).

profile_positions.description:
Research focus on meaningful learning to teach in learning communities within the workplace learning environment (school and institution based learning; school-university partnerships).
A second and parallel focus is on quality assurance and monitoring and developing a widely supported quality culture.
A third focus is on embedding research results in the university curriculum and in the (daily) actions of lecturers and prospective teachers.
Every year about three to five practice based research projects are carried out. At this moment scientific research projects include co-supervision of three doctoral dissertation research studies. ‘The voice of the young child’ by Anja Tertoolen, Msc. (Free University Amsterdam). ‘Prospective primary education teachers’ learning profile and learning environment in an academic learning trajectory’ by Stella van der Wal-Maris and ‘Teachers as Change agents’ by Monique van der Heijden, Msc. (both Eindhoven School of Education, Technical University Eindhoven).

The research part of a newly founded Master Learning and innovation was developed as well as an integrated research curriculum for prospective teachers. Furthermore the start of a challenge program (for excellence) at the university was closely monitored.
profile_positions.title: Professor (UAS) ‘Meaningful learning to teach within the workplace learning environment’

profile_positions.company: Kempel Research Center, University of Professional Teacher Education ‘De Kempel’
profile_positions.description:
Appointment as associate lector in 2005 at the establishing and incorporating of the ‘Kempel Research Center’ as a unit in the University for Teacher Education under inspiring leadership of professor (lector) Herman Popeijus. In the same period a think-learn-act model: retrospect-redesign-try out-research-reflect (R2 T R2 or in Dutch: ‘ROTOR’) was developed as an educational improvement of the PDCA cycle.
Over thirty scientific and practice based research studies and school development projects were successfully carried out varying from ‘regulated and self-regulated studying’, the ‘learnability of the study program to ‘research in the curriculum’ and ‘an excellence program evaluated’. Several awards were obtained and two books (in dutch) published. One is out of stock. The other is still available: Popeijus, H. & Geldens, J. (Eds.), Betekenisvol leren onderwijzen in de werkplekleeromgeving [Meaningful learning to teach within the workplace learning environment.] Antwerpen / Apeldoorn: Garant.
